rules.source_text: Cal. Unemp. Ins. Code § 3301(a): An individual shall be eligible for family temporary disability insurance benefits if unable to perform regular work because needed to care for a seriously ill family member or to bond with a minor child within one year of birth or placement. Effective January 1, 2025 (AB 2123), benefit rates increased to 70%-90% of wages depending on income level.
Cal. Unemp. Ins. Code § 2652: An individual is eligible for disability benefits if during the base period the individual received wages of not less than three hundred dollars ($300).

parameters.note: No employer size exemption for CA PFL — all employers covered

rules.source_text: Cal. Unemp. Ins. Code § 3300-3306: California PFL is a state-administered insurance program funded through employee payroll deductions. There is no employer size threshold; all employees who have paid into SDI are eligible regardless of employer size.
